column4: I installed Ubuntu replacing plain Debian when I had a gigantic mess of unsatisfiable dependencies
how'd you install?  overwriting?  or by *cough* changing repos?
backed up /home, reformatted, and installed
and you're getting the dependency issues when using your apt interface?
I got them from dselect
so *that's* what that button is for. :)
what are the urls for bp and extras in sources.list?
they seem ok....and you've done an apt-get update?
I'm trying to do so, byt apt-get update Ign's every -extra and -backport
your nick reminds me of rpgworld
you'll have to explain that :)
oh, ok :)
seeing as you're a console buff, do you know if it's possible to change the refresh rate?
60Hz is hard on the eyes
heh, not sure to be honest
so what'd the next step be after working out which mode?
is it text or framebuffer?
framebuffer i think
no, VGA does text as well as graphics.  What option did you pass?
vga=0x318, which is apparently 1024x768
fbset will let you do whatever you want
thanks, will look into it
